tweet_synthesis_framework.title: Faytuks Network Tweet Synthesis Framework
tweet_synthesis_framework.description: Framework for generating historically-grounded, thematic tweets that draw parallels between Iran's past and the 2026 revolution

temporal_layers.description: Every tweet should be rooted in historical context. Use these time layers to add depth.

near_term.tweet_structure: What just happened + immediate historical echo
near_term.sample: Rasht Bazaar 2026: regime traps protesters, sets fire, shoots those surrendering. Cinema Rex 1978: Islamists trap civilians, set fire, blame Shah. Same fire. Same killers. Different victims.

mid_term.focus: Islamic Republic era patterns, previous uprisings
mid_term.tweet_structure: Current event + pattern across Islamic Republic + escalating trend
mid_term.sample: 1988: 5,000 prisoners executed. 2019: 1,500 protesters killed. 2022: 500+ killed. 2026: 12,000+ massacred. Each uprising bigger. Each crackdown bloodier. The regime is running out of bullets AND time.

long_term.focus: Deep history, civilizational patterns, constitutional memory
long_term.tweet_structure: Current event + deep historical root + civilizational context
long_term.sample: 1906: Iran's Constitutional Revolution - first in Islamic world. 1979: Mullahs hijacked it. 2026: Iranians finally finishing what 1906 started. 120 years to complete one revolution.

pattern_1_fire_parallel.name: The Fire Pattern
pattern_1_fire_parallel.example: 1978: Islamists burn 400 alive in Cinema Rex, blame Shah. 2026: Same Islamists burn protesters in Rasht, blame 'rioters.' The arsonists never changed. Only their victims.

pattern_2_counter_revolution.name: The Counter-Revolution Pattern
pattern_2_counter_revolution.template: [1978 aspiration] ‚Üí [1979 hijacking] ‚Üí [47 years of tyranny] ‚Üí [2026 completion]
pattern_2_counter_revolution.example: 1978: Iranians wanted freedom. 1979: Khomeini stole it. For 47 years the counter-revolution ruled. 2026: The real revolution finally arrives. Better late than never.

pattern_3_western_betrayal.name: The Western Betrayal Pattern
pattern_3_western_betrayal.description: Guadeloupe 1979 vs 2026 - will they betray again?
pattern_3_western_betrayal.example: Guadeloupe 1979: Carter, France, UK, Germany agreed Shah must go. Khomeini thanked them. 47 years of terror followed. 2026: Another crossroads. Choose wisely this time.

pattern_4_ethnic_unity.name: The Unity Pattern
pattern_4_ethnic_unity.description: Iran isn't Yugoslavia - ethnic unity proven
pattern_4_ethnic_unity.template: [Historical test of unity] ‚Üí [Result] ‚Üí [Current unity] ‚Üí [Why it holds]
pattern_4_ethnic_unity.example: 1980: Saddam invaded, expecting Khuzestan Arabs to join him. They fought FOR Iran. 1946: Soviets tried to split off Azerbaijan. It stayed Iranian. 2026: Kurds, Azeris, Persians, Baluch - all chanting together. 2,500 years of unity doesn't break.

pattern_5_geography_fortress.name: The Fortress Pattern
pattern_5_geography_fortress.example: Last successful invasion of Iran: Mongols, 1220. Since then, mountains stopped everyone. Arabs, Turks, Soviets, Saddam - all absorbed or defeated. That's why this revolution must come from within. And it is.

pattern_6_great_power_game.name: The Great Power Pattern
pattern_6_great_power_game.description: How to navigate China, Russia, West
pattern_6_great_power_game.example: 1828: Treaty of Turkmenchay - Russia took the Caucasus. 2021: Mullahs signed new 'Turkmenchay' with China. 2026: A free Iran will be partner to all, client to none.

pattern_7_iraq_contrast.name: The Iraq Contrast Pattern
pattern_7_iraq_contrast.example: Iraq 2003: No democratic history. Afghanistan: 30% literacy. Iran 2026: Constitutional revolution since 1906. 97% literacy. 60% of university students are women. Don't compare them.

pattern_8_diaspora_return.name: The Return Pattern
pattern_8_diaspora_return.example: 4 million Iranians in exile. Engineers, doctors, entrepreneurs. Their parents left in 1979. Their grandchildren speak Persian at home. They're waiting. The moment the mullahs fall, watch the airports.

tone: Critical of regime, not Iranian people

tweets: THREAD: The Fire Pattern - How the Islamic Republic is using the same tactic that CREATED it üßµ
August 19, 1978: Cinema Rex, Abadan. Doors locked. Film playing. 377-470 people burned alive. Khomeini immediately blamed the Shah. The world believed him.
January 8, 2026: Rasht Bazaar. Protesters surrounded. Fire set. Those who surrendered with raised hands: shot dead. The regime blames 'rioters and terrorists.'
Here's the truth about Cinema Rex: Four Islamist militants did it. Hossein Takbalizadeh confessed in 1980. He said a local cleric called Abadan men 'soft' and needed to be 'shown.'
For 47 years the mullahs ruled on the ashes of Cinema Rex - a massacre THEY committed but blamed on the Shah. Now they're doing it again. Same fire. Same lies. Different victims.
The people setting fires haven't changed since 1978. Only their uniforms have.
THREAD: 1979 wasn't a revolution. It was a counter-revolution. Here's what really happened üßµ
1978: Millions of Iranians rose against the Shah. Leftists, liberals, nationalists, Islamists - united. They wanted freedom, democracy, an end to SAVAK. They succeeded.
Then Khomeini hijacked it. Within months: leftists purged. Liberals sidelined. Nationalists arrested. By 1981: mass executions. 1988: 5,000-30,000 political prisoners killed.
Christopher Hitchens called it perfectly: 'a counter-revolutionary mission to destroy the people's revolution.' Fred Halliday agreed. The broad coalition was systematically eliminated.
The Iran of 2026 isn't revolting AGAINST a revolution. It's completing the revolution that was STOLEN in 1979. 47 years later, the real revolutionaries' grandchildren finish the job.
When you hear 'Javid Shah' in the streets, understand: they're not mourning monarchy. They're reclaiming the constitutional dream that predates 1979. The dream of 1906.
THREAD: 'Remember Iraq!' they say. Here's why Iran in 2026 is the OPPOSITE of Iraq in 2003 üßµ
Iraq 2003: Artificial state created by Britain in 1920. Three provinces, three peoples, held together only by Saddam's brutality. ZERO democratic history.
Iran 2026: Constitutional Revolution in 1906 - FIRST in the Islamic world. Parliamentary tradition older than most European nations. Democratic PM Mossadegh in 1951.
Iraq's problem: No national identity. Sunni vs Shia vs Kurd. Iran's reality: 2,500 years of Persian identity. Khuzestan Arabs fought FOR Iran against Saddam. Unity proven.
Iraq's saboteur: Iran next door, flooding it with weapons and militias for 20 years. Iran's situation: Who can play that role? Russia is busy. China doesn't care. Arab states want regime gone.
The 'Iraq lesson' is real: Don't impose democracy where it never existed. Iran's lesson is different: DO support democracy where people are DYING for it. They're not the same.
